snippet: Within a five-year, $300 billion measure are dozens of provisions providing new policies and consumer protections.
abstract: Transportation bill overwhelmingly approved by both House and Senate contains dozens of policy changes that have received little attention but will affect almost everyone who uses, builds or repairs any components of nation's transportation system; some of most prominent changes include switching some Interstate highways to toll roads, allowing private-sector competition for Amtrak and increase in cap on fine regulators can impose on automobile makers due to unreported safety defects.

byline.original: By RON NIXON and DANIELLE IVORY

lead_paragraph: Within a five-year, $300 billion measure are dozens of provisions providing new policies and consumer protections.

headline.main: Transportation Bill Is Full of Little-Heralded Changes
headline.print_headline: Key Measures Hitch Ride as Roads Bill Is Approved
